intro: Diospyros nodosa, commonly known as the clustered persimmon, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and smooth, dark green leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, orange-red berries that are rich in nutrients. Diospyros nodosa thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Its ornamental value and edible fruits make it both ecologically and economically significant in its native habitat.
